Quotes: What the world requires of the Christians is that they should continue to be Christians.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Atheism shows strength of mind, but only to a certain degree.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: In every man sleeps a prophet, and when he wakes there is a little more evil in the world.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Next to religion, let your care be to promote justice.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: The Bible is a sanctum;the world, sputum.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: Martyrs do not underrate the body, they allow it to be elevated on the cross. In this they are at one with their antagonists.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: Every church is a stone on the grave of a god-man: it does not want him to rise up again under any circumstances.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The word "Christianity" is already a misunderstanding - in reality there has been only one Christian, and he died on the Cross.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Opposition may become sweet to a man when he has christened it persecution.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Science is properly more scrupulous than dogma. Dogma gives a charter to mistake, but the very breath of science is a contest with mistake, and must keep the conscience alive.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: One cannot really be a Catholic and grown up.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Mankind is not likely to salvage civilization unless he can evolve a system of good and evil which is independent of heaven and hell.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Nothing is divine but what is agreeable to reason.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quotes: Religious persecutors are not believers, they are rascals.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: Jesus was all right, but his disciples were thick and ordinary. It's them twisting it that ruins it for me.
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: If the grandfather of the grandfather of Jesus had known what was hidden within him, he would have stood humble and awe-struck before his soul.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes: I have a great mind to believe in Christianity for the mere pleasure of fancying I may be damned.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Everything great in the world comes from neurotics. They alone have founded our religions and composed our masterpieces.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: The Christian's Bible is a drug store. Its contents remain the same, but the medical practice changes.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Mysticism and exaggeration go together. A mystic must not fear ridicule if he is to push all the way to the limits of humility or the limits of delight.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Those who consider the Devil to be a partisan of Evil and angels to be warriors for Good accept the demagogy of the angels. Things are clearly more complicated.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Words which do not give the light of Christ increase the darkness.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: Each one of them is Jesus in disguise.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: A faith is a necessity to a man. Woe to him who believes in nothing.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Of all religions, the Christian should of course inspire the most tolerance, but until now Christians have been the most intolerant of all men.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The devil can cite Scripture for his purpose.
Author: William Shakespeare
